Administration.text:
Type: Enzyme
Dosage Forms: Solution; 1.5mg & 7.5mg
Routes of Administration: IV
Common Trade Names: Elitek

Adult_Dosing.text: Hyperuricemia due to tumor lysis syndrome: 0.2 mg/kg IV over 30 minutes daily for up to 5 days

Pediatric_Dosing.text: 0.2 mg/kg IV over 30 minutes daily for up to 5 days

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: C
Lactation risk
: Infant risk cannot be ruled out
Renal dosing:
Hepatic dosing:

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
G6PD deficiency
History of hemolytic reaction to rasburicase or any excipients
History of methemoglobinemia reaction to rasburicase or any excipients

Serious.text:
Dysrhythmia, MI, heart failure, cardiac arrest
Bowel obstruction
Severe diarrhea, dehydration
Methemoglobinemia
Neutropenia, hemolysis, thrombocytopenia, pancytopenia
Hemorrhage, thrombosis
Sepsis
Stroke
Renal failure
Pulmonary edema, pulmonary hypertension, pneumonia, respiratory distress
Fever (severe), rigors

Common.text:
Peripheral Edema
Fever
Rash
Diarrhea, nausea/vomiting, constipation, abdominal pain
Mucous membrane inflammation
Headache

Mechanism_of_Action.text: Enzyme catalyzes oxidation of uric acid into inactive and soluble metabolite
